title: Cucumber soup with prawn skewers

ingredients.content: 500 g salad cucumbers, preferably unpeeled, cut in pieces
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade

preparations.content: Place olive oil, 1 tbsp lemon juice and salt in mixing bowl and mix <b>3 sec/speed 3<b> to make a marinade.
Place prawns in a bowl and coat with 2 tbsp marinade. Allow to rest for 10 minutes while preparing the soup.
Add onions and garlic cloves to remaining marinade in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add salad cucumbers and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>, then sauté <b>6 min/120°C/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, thread prawns alternately with quartered lemon slices onto 6 wooden skewers and arrange them in Varoma dish.
Add water, vegetable stock paste, black pepper and remaining marinade from prawns to mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and cook <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Set Varoma aside.

Add milk, flour and remaining 1 tbsp lemon juice to mixing bowl and blend <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>-9, increasing speed gradually.<b> Remove measuring cup, set Varoma back in position and cook <b>2 min/100°C/speed 3<b>. Set Varoma aside.

Add dill to mixing bowl, season to taste and blend until frothy <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>-9, increasing speed gradually.<b> Pour soup into 6 soup bowls, place a prawn skewer on top of each bowl and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Did you know cucumbers can be served in a soup? For a creamy white soup, peel the cucumbers, and for a pale green soup, leave the skin on. Either way is perfect when you have a bumper crop in the garden. The prawn skewers add a touch of elegance and complement the flavour of the soup.
Instead of flour use <b>150 g cooked<b> potatoes, cut in pieces, to thicken the soup.
Use cream instead of milk, or half cream, half milk.

For vegetarian skewers, replace lemon slices with cherry tomatoes and prawns with one or several of the following: small mushrooms <b>(Ø 3 cm),<b> feta cheese cubes, or tofu cubes marinated in soy sauce.
The soup can also be seasoned with a splash of dry white wine.
If using frozen prawns, defrost before marinating.
Unpeeled cucumbers give more colour and flavour to the soup.
Long skewers can be cut to fit the Varoma dish.
In hot weather this soup can be served chilled. For a fresh summer flavour, replace dill with fresh mint or coriander.
